content:
Congratulations on your sourdough success! That's fantastic news! King Arthur Flour's recipe is a great resource, and it's wonderful that you were able to achieve such great results on your first try.

Sourdough bread is a whole different beast compared to ciabatta, and it requires a lot of patience and dedication. But the reward is well worth it – the unique flavor and texture of sourdough are truly special.

I'm curious, what was the most challenging part of making your sourdough bread? Was it creating and maintaining the sourdough starter, or was it the longer proofing and baking times?

And now that you've successfully made sourdough, are you planning to experiment with different sourdough recipes or flavor combinations? There are so many possibilities, from adding nuts or seeds to using different types of flour or creating a sourdough rye.

By the way, have you thought about sharing your sourdough starter with friends or family, or starting a sourdough starter exchange? Sourdough starters can be a great way to connect with other bakers and share the love of bread-making.
